data.title: Hadar Huberman on LinkedIn: #foodtech #london
data.meta_description: Last week I had the honor of taking 10 innovative, diverse and market ready #foodtech startups to #London, in the first ever Israeli delegation to the UK in‚Ä¶
data.text:
üçä üíª Spain maintains its position as one of the most prolific ecosystems for #foodtech #entrepreneurship, with 420 start-ups and they have raised more than ‚Ç¨226 million in different investment rounds. üìù The report FoodTech in Spain Fostering Collaboration for Sustainable Agri-Food Excellence, promoted by #ICEX Spain Export and Investment and #investinSpain show that the foodtech sector is an essential link in the Spanish food industry and will play an important role in the food chain in the coming years. ‚¨Ü The report also reveals how the number of start-ups continues to grow, albeit at a moderate pace, and the emergence of new players and alliances that are set to boost innovation throughout the food chain. üìç In recent years, #Spain has become one of the few #foodtech nations, developing an enterprising ecosystem across the entire agri-food value chain. üîº More than 30,000 companies in food transformation; more than 50 specialized #universities and more than 20 cutting edge #technological centres. üåç Within the European economic landscape, the Spanish food industry claims the fourth position in terms of turnover, comprising 11.4%, trailing behind France (18.9%), Germany (16.5%), and Italy (12.8%). So Why invest in Spain‚Äôs agri-food industry? üìä Agri-food is a key industry in the Spanish economy. It is strong and resilient and is the country's top-ranked industry. üëá Find out more and download our latest report 2023: https://lnkd.in/dk7z4bPa #ICEX #investinspain #entrepeneurship #foodtech #report #agrifood #industry

Reflecting on a Year of Israeli High-Tech üáÆüá± Noga Sela Shalev, CEO of Fresh Start foodtech incubator, shares insights from the foodtech sector: "The Israeli agri-food industry had a rollercoaster year. Alongside some major achievements, many foodtech companies struggled to secure funding. While the lofty promises of revolutionizing the food and beverage industry still hold, the challenges of regulations and infrastructure showed us that mass production is a long road ahead. On the other hand, we're witnessing exciting technologies emerging, poised to enhance scalability, improve quality, nutrition, and affordability in future products. This keeps our optimism high for what's to come." For the full Israel Hayom ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú ◊î◊ô◊ï◊ù article (in Hebrew), visit >> https://lnkd.in/d3P9SbmB #FoodTechExperts #StartupIncubator #InnovationNation #IsraeliHiTechStars #FoodTechIndustry #YearInReview #ExpertInsights Tammy Meiron, Ph.D., Daniel Gamsu, Hadas Sibony Benyamini, Ariella Artzi Henig, Sapir Hashmonai, Tom Kaverman, Tnuva, Tempo Beverages Ltd, OurCrowd, Finistere Ventures, Israel Innovation Authority ◊®◊©◊ï◊™ ◊î◊ó◊ì◊©◊†◊ï◊™

Thanks a lot to FoodHack Ville de Lausanne Team Camille Aouina√Øt, Jean-Marc Parveaux, Luc-Etienne D. for having organised last night event so well and for their invitation. ENDEAVOUR DEVELOPMENT INTERNATIONAL would like to underline their key role in supporting dot connections amongst start-up entrepreneurs, scientists, investors, experts, job seekers and politicians over the agrofood ecosystem. As food is one of key pillars of mankind future, it's essential that each of us feel committed to do its share. Thanks also to Rapha√´l Lutz for providing us with welcoming facilities and La Sobrerie for its support to this event. I also wanted to thank Laurence Jeangros and Heiko Specking for the insightful and complementary interactions we had during the roundtable session, and the audience for their relevant questions and exchanges during the cocktail. As a conclusion of this session, let's keep in mind: - solutions to current nutrition and agricultural challenges are so many, there is not ONE way only. - actors of change are scientists, start-up entrepreneurs, small & medium-sized companies and citizens ; every one has to do its share. - changes will come with frugal innovation, ESR, vision, commitment and endurance (one good example is the #demain documentary by Cyril Dion and M√©lanie Laurent) - governments can't decide for everybody ; most important is to allow virtuous initiatives #innovation #food #growthacceleration #innovationgeneration #agroalimentaire #startup #agilite #agility #frontendinnovation #routetomarket # Some actors of change met in the audience : Christian Moreillon, Alfred Yoakim, Etienne Arnoux, .....

Heading to #Paris next week to speak to agrifoodtech innovators! In this workshop held during ShakeUp Factory, EIT Food and Big Idea Ventures‚Äô Demo Day - The New Food Paradigm, YC Choy, Naomin Tan and I will be joined by: Fr√©d√©ric BOUVIER of Roquette; Marit Keemink of Meatable; and Isabelle DECITRE of ID Capital Pte. #Asia has become the largest region in the global food market. Asian consumers will spend an additional USD 4.4 trillion on food over the next ten years, as massive demographic changes and evolving consumer needs drive up demand for larger quantities and better quality food. To meet this demand sustainably, new technology, processes and mindsets must be introduced to the food industry, and that paradigm shift has taken place on every continent, but none more so than in #SoutheastAsia (SEA) where agriculture is a major economic and social activity. SEA has more than 270 agrifood tech startups which have attracted more than ‚Ç¨3.3 billion between 2013 to 2022. Furthermore, between 2019 to 2022, the SEA ecosystem grew 54% (CAGR), as opposed to 13% for the global ecosystem. We will deep dive into how #Singapore is going to achieve its ambitious vision to treble domestic food production with the help of innovative technology and forward-thinking regulations. Join us to learn key opportunities for #agrifood tech startups in Southeast Asia and how to capitalise on various support mechanisms offered by the Singapore ecosystem. Register to secure your spot: https://lnkd.in/eDPtWv6S Zhilin Sim Sarah Gomez-Herrera Brandon Chia Alyssia Lam ËìùÊò±Áê™ SzeKi Sim

Africa aims to leverage Israel's advanced agricultural technology to enhance its organic produce yield. This surplus could be marketed to both Israel and global markets, simultaneously strengthening domestic food security, according to Segun Olusegun Olanipekun, president of the African Leadership Summit (ALS). Earlier this month, Olanipekun headed a delegation to Israel comprising over 50 African leaders, including politicians and business people. Their primary objective was to explore the potential of harnessing Israeli innovation. "We want to seize the opportunity and build this highway," said Olanipekun, also the CEO and founder of the African Israel Chamber of Commerce (AICC). The delegation participated in a multi-day business summit as part of a collaboration with Mountain View Consulting Agency and the Heartland Initiative. The events were hosted at the Azrieli Towers in Tel Aviv and the Ramada Hotel Queen Sheba Conference Hall, along with several site visits. The participants came from various corners of Africa, including South Africa, Nigeria, Botswana, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Uganda, Ghana, Kenya, and Angola. Olanipekun launched the AICC 10 years ago, hosting its first summit in 2013 in Jerusalem. The goal is to "build a highway" between Africa and Israel so that Africa can better benefit from the Start-up Nation. "We have observed the start-up culture, the way Israel uses entrepreneurs to unlock the Israeli economy, and we want to see that in different parts of Africa," Olanipekun explained. https://lnkd.in/guuZtKcq

Firsts days are best because they are beginnings. Summer time is over and a new school year starts: I look forward (about time üòÖ) to take my children to the school bus stop. Other things to look forward to this autumn: New strategic alliances between Gastronomy Open Ecosystem and global partners to create new food and ingredients that are sustainable, healthy and, specially fun. Let‚Äôs call it #HedonisticSustainability. The future of food and gastronomy does not need to be neither dystopian nor boring. Being sustainable, healthy and affordable is not enough. Gastronomy puts the required ‚Äúhuman factor‚Äù on those new products. I look forward to create and promote with our partners great ‚ÄúTesla moments‚Äù (Nadav Berger üòâ) on food and gastronomy. Speaking of sustainable hedonism: this autumn we will also set the first stone of the GOe center with our friends from BIG - Bjarke Ingels Group and BAT - Bilbao Architecture Team I also look forward to the new developments from Cardumen Capital FoodTech Fund and the new incubator along with a new edition of Culinary Action! Global Foodtech, already the largest international FoodTech accelerator event in the world: Tokyo (Japan stop will be quiet special this year), Buenos Aires, Copenhague, New York, Tel Aviv and San Sebasti√°n ‚Ä¶ connecting ecosystems from four continents üöÄ The European Commission chose after all Culinary Action! as the best initiative to foster entrepreneurship in Europe: Dreams should come, after all, a size too big, so that we can grow into them. The team at Basque Culinary Center we continue to grow to fit into them, with more things to come. But first, let‚Äôs start making it on time in the morning to the school bus. Step by step üôåüöê ü§û Http://goe.bculinary.com BCC Innovation Irekia EJGV Ekonomiaren Garapena - Desarrollo Econ√≥mico [EJ-GV] #TheFoodGlobalEcosystem #GastronomyOpenEcosystem #HAZI #Entrepeneurship #Foodtech #FoodInnovation #GastronomyOpenEcosystem

By 2022, the global FoodTech sector skyrocketed to a valuation of US $260 billion, with the MENA region bursting with vibrant FoodTech innovations, it became a significant contributor to this booming industry. üöÄ We are excited to announce "The Growing Business of Foodtech" - an insightful report crafted in collaboration with Lucidity Insights and Entrepreneur Middle East. Get an in-depth look at how technology is reshaping the food industry in the GCC, spurred by governmental initiatives, a surge in food security awareness, and a thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem. Explore the future of food and meet the region's most innovative FoodTech players. Download the full report üëâ https://lnkd.in/gszx66Aj #FoodTech #MENAInnovations #FoodicsReport2023 #FoodTechFuture

üåç Impact Hub Berlin released its latest #sustainablefood Trends report. This in-depth analysis of the #agrifood industry reveals the #foodtrends shaping what and how we eat. üîé The report explores how agri-food systems in the #DACH region are changing, who is changing them and looks at the collective impact of entrepreneurs, initiatives and corporations. Together we can shape the future of food production and consumption for the better. In this publication, you will also find: üçè A look at the many innovative start-ups making real change üçΩÔ∏è Ways to strengthen local food ecosystems and cultures ‚ôªÔ∏è Creative solutions that bring sustainability down to earth üìà Key facts and figures about the food industry And more. üèÖ We feel honored that Coffee Annan represents the subtrend 'Decolonising & Empowering' together with these organizations: Bake for Ukraine, Conflictfood and The Rainforest Company. All of us are committed to building a food chain grounded in equity. ‚öì The Impact Hub anchored the concept of radical collaboration for impact innovations with the launch of the Ecosystem model. This model aims to foster cross-sector partnerships and co-creation of solutions for the most pressing social and environmental challenges. Similarly, Coffee Annan pursues the goal of increasing value creation in coffee-producing countries. We aim to steadily contribute more to the United Nations Social Development Goal 17, which calls for strengthening the means of implementation and revitalizing the global partnership for sustainable development. ‚û°Ô∏è Download the full report here: https://zurl.co/BQxL

We were mentioned in The Good Food Institute APAC 2023 State of the Industry Report! We‚Äôre proud to be based here in Singapore, a hub for global food tech start-ups and a testbed exporting R&D globally. Team ScaleUp Bio was highlighted in the report as a co-manufacturer serving local and global food tech start-ups. We‚Äôre offering a one-stop-shop of solutions to address the challenges they often face. Our expertise, capacity, and blue-chip access allow these start-ups to ScaleUp to success from Singapore, to Asia, and beyond. ScaleUp Bio is part of a larger ecosystem, including our parent and sister companies, research institutions and industry partners. We‚Äôre in a unique position to enable food tech start-ups to bring their food innovations from bench-to-market. Thank you to our corporate parents, global nutrition leader, ADM and Temasek‚Äôs very own Nurasa for supporting us in developing the facilities needed for tomorrow‚Äôs food revolution. Reach out to us at hello@scaleupbio.com to ScaleUp to success today. #foodrevolution #futurefood #sustainability #startup #startups #sustainable #food #solutions #asiapacific #innovation #growth #commercialisation #ecosystem #collaboration #nutrition #singapore #precisionfermentation #foodgrade #businessassistance #cdmo #technology

The yearly flagship food innovation event (the V International FoodTech Forum and the IV FoodTech Expo) is taking place on June 5th and 6th in Campinas, Brazil. It is organized by Food Tech Hub Latam and would not have been possible without Dr. Paulo Silveira who has an unmatched and contagious passion for a transformative and resilient food system Built on its huge success in 2023 as I had the privilege to witness in Brazil, this year‚Äôs event has a number of new and critically important focus areas: 1) global strategies to reduce carbon footprint; 2) tech-driven food sustainability (precision fermentation); 3) digitalization of agri-food supply chain (reshaping the future of cocoa); 4) technology deployment for better nutrition, among other topics. It is expected to attract active local and international participations brings together companies, universities, governmental and non-governmental bodies, FoodTech startups, VCs among others. To be part of this event, please register at: https://lnkd.in/d5YVAcUf #agrifoodtech #sustainabledevelopment #foodsecurity #partnership Paula Hemerly Ananda Okamura
